column4: I need a powerful tool to convert HD videos to mp4... any tips? :)
I have 24G of RAM on a core i7 and would like to take advantage of it
ffmpeg, mencoder, most gui front ends and tools can do that.
be sure the multithread encoding features are enabled.
oh! Where do I check that?
in the docs for whatever tool you are using. I noticed it one day in winff it was just using 1 core. I had to add a option to the cli settings
yeah, that is the reason I came here to ask... I am using WinFF and it is not fast at all. Maybe that's the reason! :)
I  recall getting the exact info from the askubuntu forums I think on ffmpeg multithread or winff multithread options
watch your cpu load. here it would 100% 1 core.
of course your whold system will start lagging if you use too many threads
I thought there was some way to optimize the encoding proccess... my video files are all above 1G each and I have to encode 12 of them per day! :)
from the winff docs (i just looked) it uses  '-threads 2'  if multithreading is enabled. you can set it to use moar..
faster speeds  can result in worse quality.. so its a trade off. if you are using all your cores. ;)
yes, there is an option in the preferences to allow it to use multithreads. I hope it improves the speed, cause i need much much moar :)
I think you want threads  one less then the # of cores.
I can dedicate the machine to encoding, so it's no biggy :)
you may want to see what command line winff is using, and use it as a base to tweak your own set of alias's
